summary.span: 为 实现提供基类。

span.span: Provides a base class for implementations.

summary.span: 此类为抽象类。

span.span: This class is abstract.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A可以用于创建和检索代码生成器和代码编译器的实例。A can be used to create and retrieve instances of code generators and code compilers. 代码生成器可用于以特定的语言生成代码，而代码编译器可用于将代码编译为程序集。Code generators can be used to generate code in a particular language, and code compilers can be used to compile code into assemblies. > [!NOTE] > 在[!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)]、 方法可在代码生成器和代码编译器都可直接从代码提供程序。In the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)], the methods made available in the code generator and code compiler are available directly from the code provider. 不需要调用或访问，以及这些方法标记为过时。You do not need to call or to access the methods, and those methods are marked as obsolete. 这适用于预先存在的以及新的代码提供程序实现。This applies to preexisting as well as new code provider implementations. A实现通常提供的代码生成和/或代码编译接口，用于生成代码和管理一种编程语言的编译。A implementation typically provides code generation and/or code compilation interfaces for generating code and managing compilation for a single programming language. 支持多种语言附带的实现[!INCLUDE[winsdklong](~/includes/winsdklong-md.md)]。Several languages are supported by implementations that ship with the [!INCLUDE[winsdklong](~/includes/winsdklong-md.md)]. 这些语言包括 C#、Visual Basic、C++ 和 JScript。These languages include C#, Visual Basic, C++, and JScript. 开发人员或编译器供应商可以实现和接口，并提供的 CodeDOM 将支持扩展到其他编程语言。Developers or compiler vendors can implement the and interfaces and provide a that extends CodeDOM support to other programming languages. [ <System.codedom>元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/compiler/system-codedom-element.md)计算机配置文件 (Machine.config) 提供了面向开发人员和编译器供应商可以添加其他的配置设置的机制实现。The [<system.codedom> Element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/compiler/system-codedom-element.md) in the machine configuration file (Machine.config) provides a mechanism for developers and compiler vendors to add configuration settings for additional implementations. 类提供静态方法，以发现和枚举的计算机上的实现。The class provides static methods to discover and enumerate the implementations on a computer. 方法返回的所有设置的计算机上的实现。The method returns the settings for all implementations on a computer. 方法返回特定的设置实现中，根据编程语言名称。The method returns the settings for a specific implementation, based on the programming language name. 方法返回的实例特定语言的实现。The method returns an instance of a implementation for a specific language. 有关配置文件中的语言提供程序设置的更多详细信息，请参阅[编译器和语言提供程序设置架构](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c020b139-8699-4f0d-9ac9-70d0c5b2a8c8)。For more details on language provider settings in the configuration file, see [Compiler and Language Provider Settings Schema](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c020b139-8699-4f0d-9ac9-70d0c5b2a8c8). > [!NOTE] > 此类，使链接要求，并且在类级别继承要求。This class makes a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level. A如果直接调用方或派生的类没有完全信任权限，则引发。A is thrown if either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have full trust permission. 有关安全要求的详细信息，请参阅[链接需求](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md)和[的继承需求](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9)。For details about security demands, see [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md) and [Inheritance Demands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9). ## Examples 下面的示例程序可以生成和编译的程序，将打印"Hello World"使用的 CodeDOM 模型所基于的源代码类。The following example program can generate and compile source code based on a CodeDOM model of a program that prints "Hello World" using the class. 提供 Windows 窗体用户界面。A Windows Forms user interface is provided. 用户可以选择目标编程语言从几个选项： C#、 Visual Basic 和 JScript。The user can select the target programming language from several selections: C#, Visual Basic, and JScript. [!code-cpp[CodeDomExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeDomExample/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[CodeDomExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeDomExample/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[CodeDomExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodeDomExample/VB/source.vb#1)]

In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, code providers consist of implementations of , , , and . remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 在.NET framework 1.0 和 1.1 版中，此方法由实现返回的提供程序的方法。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, this method is provided by the implementation that is returned by the method of the provider. 在 2.0 版中，此方法可以调用的代码提供程序上直接即使它不被覆盖的代码提供程序。In version 2.0, this method can be called directly on the code provider even if it is not overridden by the code provider. 如果代码提供程序不重写此方法，供基类调用实现。If the code provider does not override this method, the implementation is called by the base class.

exception.span: 此方法和 方法均不在派生类中重写。

span.span: Neither this method nor the method is overridden in a derived class.

span.para: 如果你重写此方法，你必须调用基类的对应方法。基类方法使用过时的派生类中创建的生成器与预先存在的提供程序使用代码编译器的兼容性的方法。基类方法然后调用中的等效方法实现来执行此功能。你将获得如果不使用代码编译器的代码提供调用基类方法。

If you override this method, you must not call the corresponding method of the base class. The base-class method creates a generator in the derived class using the obsolete method for compatibility with preexisting providers that use code compilers. The base-class method then calls the equivalent method in the implementation to perform this function. You will get a if you call the base-class method from a code provider that does not use a code compiler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 测试标识符是否与任何保留相冲突或语言关键字和如果是这样，返回一个等效的带有特定于语言的转义码格式设置的名称。 tests whether the identifier conflicts with any reserved or language keywords, and if so, returns an equivalent name with language-specific escape code formatting. 这称为转义标识符。This is referred to an escaped identifier. 转义的标识符包含相同`value`但添加了转义代码格式设置，以使标识符与关键字区分开来。The escaped identifier contains the same `value` but has escape-code formatting added to differentiate the identifier from the keyword. 两个实现示例是前面`value`使用"@"或包括`value`与"["和"]"。Two implementation examples are preceding the `value` with "@" or bracketing the `value` with "[" and "]". > [!NOTE] > 在.NET framework 1.0 和 1.1 版中，此方法由实现返回的提供程序的方法。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, this method is provided by the implementation that is returned by the method of the provider. 在 2.0 版中，此方法可以调用的代码提供程序上直接即使它不被覆盖的代码提供程序。In version 2.0, this method can be called directly on the code provider even if it is not overridden by the code provider. 如果代码提供程序不重写此方法，供基类调用实现。If the code provider does not override this method, the implementation is called by the base class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 此方法通常用于应用程序可选择性地使用多个提供商之一中创建的代码提供程序实例。This method is most commonly used to create an instance of a code provider in an application that may optionally use one of several providers. 可以在运行时指定你想要实例化的代码提供程序。 allows you to specify at run time the code provider you wish to instantiate. 如果你知道在哪个代码提供程序是要使用的设计时，你应创建的该代码提供程序实例而不使用方法。If you know at design time which code provider is to be used, you should create an instance of that code provider rather than use the method. 方法返回实例特定的语言名称; 它是类似于调用与语言提供程序类型的方法。The method returns a instance for a specific language name; it is similar to calling the method with the language provider type. 使用如果想要动态找到的语言名称的配置的提供程序实现。Use when you want to dynamically find a configured provider implementation for a language name. 如果语言名称，为配置了多个提供程序实现返回最后一个匹配的配置元素的提供程序实例。If more than one provider implementation is configured for the language name, returns a provider instance for the last matching configuration element. 使用方法重载时您希望特定语言提供程序实现。Use the method overload when you want a specific language provider implementation. 例如，使用方法以获取支持的语言名称的提供程序实例`"CSharp"`; 使用方法重载来获取专为提供程序实例实现。For example, use the method to get a provider instance that supports the language name `"CSharp"`; use the method overload to get a provider instance specifically for the implementation. 应使用 [\]，CultureInfo、 对象\ 如果你有多个为一种语言的代码提供程序并且您希望其实例化特定代码提供程序的方法。You should use the [\], CultureInfo, Object\ method if you have multiple code providers for a language and you desire to instantiate a specific code provider. 方法检查是否至少一个提供程序实现支持特定语言。The method checks whether at least one provider implementation supports a specific language. 你可以验证语言名称使用之前将其传递给。You can validate a language name using before passing it to . 如果你不受支持的语言将名称传递给引发。If you pass an unsupported language name to a is thrown. 方法可以用于确定所有的计算机，包括开发人员和中标识的编译器供应商提供的其他实现上实现[ <system.codedom>元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/compiler/system-codedom-element.md)计算机配置文件 (Machine.config) 中。The method can be used to determine all implementations on a computer, including additional implementations provided by developers and compiler vendors that are identified in the [<system.codedom> Element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/compiler/system-codedom-element.md) in the machine configuration file (Machine.config). 方法返回的实例特定语言的实现。The method returns an instance of a implementation for a specific language. 语言名称不区分大小写。Language names are case-insensitive. ## Examples 下面的代码示例确定输入的语言和显示语言提供程序的配置设置的实现。The following code example determines the implementation for an input language and displays the configured settings for the language provider. 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 测试是否与保留的标识符冲突或语言关键字和如果因此，尝试返回有效的标识符名称不冲突。 tests whether the identifier conflicts with reserved or language keywords, and if so, attempts to return a valid identifier name that does not conflict. 通常返回的标识符仅略有修改以使标识符与关键字; 区分开来例如，名称可能前面使用下划线 (_) 字符。Usually the returned identifier is only slightly modified to differentiate the identifier from the keyword; for example, the name might be preceded by the underscore ("_") character. > [!NOTE] > 在.NET framework 1.0 和 1.1 版中，此方法由实现返回的提供程序的方法。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, this method is provided by the implementation that is returned by the method of the provider. 在 2.0 版中，此方法可以调用的代码提供程序上直接即使它不被覆盖的代码提供程序。In version 2.0, this method can be called directly on the code provider even if it is not overridden by the code provider. 如果代码提供程序不重写此方法，供基类调用实现。If the code provider does not override this method, the implementation is called by the base class.

exception.span: 此方法和 方法均不在派生类中重写。

span.span: Neither this method nor the method is overridden in a derived class.

span.para: 如果你重写此方法，你必须调用基类的对应方法。基类方法使用过时的派生类中创建的生成器与预先存在的提供程序使用代码生成器的兼容性的方法。基类方法然后调用中的等效方法实现来执行此功能。你将获得如果不使用代码生成器的代码提供调用基类方法。

If you override this method, you must not call the corresponding method of the base class. The base-class method creates a generator in the derived class using the obsolete method for compatibility with preexisting providers that use code generators. The base-class method then calls the equivalent method in the implementation to perform this function. You will get a if you call the base-class method from a code provider that does not use a code generator.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 在.NET framework 1.0 和 1.1 版中，此方法由实现返回的提供程序的方法。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, this method is provided by the implementation that is returned by the method of the provider. 在 2.0 版中，此方法可以调用的代码提供程序上直接即使它不被覆盖的代码提供程序。In version 2.0, this method can be called directly on the code provider even if it is not overridden by the code provider. 如果代码提供程序不重写此方法，供基类调用实现。If the code provider does not override this method, the implementation is called by the base class.

exception.span: 此方法和 方法均不在派生类中重写。

span.span: Neither this method nor the method is overridden in a derived class.

span.para: 如果你重写此方法，你必须调用基类的对应方法。基类方法使用过时的派生类中创建一个分析器与预先存在的提供程序使用代码分析程序的兼容性的方法。基类方法然后调用中的等效方法实现来执行此功能。你将获得如果从代码提供程序不使用代码分析器调用基类方法。

If you override this method, you must not call the corresponding method of the base class. The base-class method creates a parser in the derived class using the obsolete method for compatibility with preexisting providers that use code parsers. The base-class method then calls the equivalent method in the implementation to perform this function. You will get a if you call the base-class method from a code provider that does not use a code parser.

If you override this method, you must not call the corresponding method of the base class. The base-class method then calls the equivalent method in the implementation to perform this function.
